msIdentifier.institution: Royal Asiatic Society of Great Britain and Ireland

msContents.summary: A history of Shah Jahan. The latter portion of the work beginning at the eleventh year of the reign and continuing until the death of Shah Jahan. Ending with a list of mansabdars.

msItem.title: 'Amal-i Salih.
msItem.note: Front flyleaf, recto: a) Impression of small rectangular seal of Thakur Parshad dated 1224 and also with number 13 (?). b) Shah Jehan Namah containing the events of his Reign after the 10th Year of his Reign Briggs Dhooha 1819. folio 1, recto: L (?) O Knox Inside front cover, pasted slip: Lieut. Col. Briggs.
msItem.incipit: Chun ayyam-i sal-i yazdahum-i julus-i maimanat-ma'nus

bindingDesc.p: Brown and red leather binding, presumably Indian, with tooled and stamped decoration.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: History of India, Mughal period, Shah Jahan.
